Anderson John-QA2554 wrote:
>  
> Has anyone integrated and used JUnit and EMMA on a large scale
> commercial product?  If so, were you satisfied with EMMA as a code
> coverage analysis tool?  
> 
> Is there a better open source code coverage analysis tool available that
> works with JUnit? 
> 
> Are there a better commercial code coverage analysis tools available
> that work with JUnit? 

I've used the GPL'd jcoverage, cobertura (a more up-to-date rewrite of 
jcoverage), and EMMA. Of the three, I prefer cobertura for its clean 
layout. EMMA's output looks quite clunky, even though it does provide a 
bit more information than the other two.
